question: God commanded Solomon not to marry from among the Moabites, Amorites, Edomites, Sidonians and the Hitties because they___________
explanation: The Lord did not want the Israelites to worship foreign gods and being married to these foreigners could turn their hearts from God. 1 kings 11
options: Were not submissive to their Husbands
Would not worship the God of Israel
Would still go after other Men
Would turn away his heart after their gods

question:
"....But when you give alms, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing...."

From your assessment of Jesus teaching about giving, what do you think is a violation of the statement__________
explanation: It means that when you give to the needy, do it secretly. If you give to bring attention to yourself, you don't get a reward in heaven because you already have your reward in all the attention you got. So do all good works in secret as much as possible, not just giving. God will see your good works and will reward you. Matthew 6:3
options: One give only what one has
One does not give from freewill
One gives only what is requested

question: In order to receive a reward of inheritance, Paul exhorts believers to________
explanation: He rewards the meek with inheritance of the earth
options: Always pray for their daily bread

question: ".......How long will you grieve over Saul...." On what occasion did God make the statement above to Samuel?
explanation: And the Lord said to Samuel, “How long will you grieve for Saul, since I have rejected him as king over Israel? 1samuel 16:1

question: On which day did God create sea creatures and all living things?
explanation: Genesis 1:21 So God created the great creatures of the sea and every living thing with which the water teems and that moves about in it, according to their kinds, and every winged bird according to its kind. And God saw that it was good. This was done on Day5

question: In Paul's letter to the Philippians, he encouraged believers to demonstrate humility by__________
explanation: Paul's teaching on Humility (Philippians 2:1-11) In his letter to the Philippians, Paul appealed to his audience to be of one mind (united) in all that they do, and to love each other.
options: Giving honour and respect to Church elders
Honoring their Fathers and Mothers in the Lord
Seeking their own interest and that of others

question: The vision of the dry bones of Ezekiel portrays___________
explanation:
Ezekiel 37:1-10 
The Bible says these bones were "very dry" (verse 2). There wasn't any hope of life. Giving life to the dry bones represents restoration and hope

question: No one lacked in the Early Church because__________
explanation: No one claimed that any of their possessions was their own, but they shared. They lived a communal life. Acts4:32
options: The grace of God was upon them
They shared all they had in common

question: Nehemiah inquired about the state of Jerusalem from_________
explanation: Nehemiah 1:2 Hanani, one of my brothers, came from Judah with some other men, and I questioned them about the Jewish remnant that had survived the exile, and also about Jerusalem.

question: In the contest on Mount Carmel, the true God answered with__________
explanation: Elijah proposes a direct test of the powers of Baal and the Jewish God. The people of Israel, 450 prophets of Baal, and 400 prophets of Asherah are summoned to Mount Carmel. Fire fell and consumed the sacrifice, wood, stones, soil and water, which prompted the Israelite witnesses to proclaim, "The LORD, He is God! The LORD, He is God!"

question: Jeremiah was not ready to accept God's call as a prophet because______
explanation:
Jeremiah 1 :5 “Before I formed you in the womb I knew you, before you were born I set you apart; I appointed you as a prophet to the nations.”

6 “Alas, Sovereign Lord,” I said, “I do not know how to speak; I am too young.”
options: The people would not listen to him
He was too young and inexperienced
He needed to know God more

question: According to Mark, The number of Women that went to Jesus Tomb on the Morning of his resurrection to anoint him were___________
explanation: Mark16:3 When the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices so they could go and anoint Jesus’ body.

question: "When my soul fainted within me, I remembered the LORD....." Where was Jonah when he made this statement?
explanation: Jonah2:1-7 From inside the fish Jonah prayed to the Lord his God.
options: In the boat of the Mariners
In the belly of the fish

question: In his first letter to Timothy, Paul warned believers aganist the love of money, because it contends with their__________
"........Sir, did you not sow good seed in your field? How then has it weeds" What  was the response of the master to the statement above?
explanation:
Matthew13: 27 The owner’s servants came to him and said, ‘Sir, didn’t you sow good seed in your field? Where then did the weeds come from?’ 
28‘An enemy did this,’ he replied. So the servants asked him, ‘Do you want us to go and pull them up?’…

question: The council that was held to decide on the issue of circumcision was at________
explanation: It was occasioned by the insistence of certain Judaic Christians from Jerusalem that Gentile Christians from Antioch in Syria obey the Mosaic custom of circumcision. A delegation, led by the Apostle Paul and his companion St. Barnabas, was appointed to confer with the elders of the church in Jerusalem

question: Hosea compared Judah's love for he Lord to the morning clouds because it_________
explanation: Your love is like a morning cloud, like the dew that goes early away. Hosea 6:4
options: Went away early like the dew

question: According to Mathew, when Jesus was arrested, He led to_____________
explanation: Then the people who had arrested Jesus led him to the home of Caiaphas, the high priest, where the teachers of religious law and the elders had gathered. Matthew 26:57

question: The way in which various people hear the word of God is described in the parable of the ______
explanation: The Parable of the Sower  is a parable of Jesus found in the three Synoptic Gospels in Matthew 13:1-23, Mark 4:1-20, and Luke 8:4-15. ''Some seed falls on the path (wayside) with no soil, some on rocky ground with little soil, and some on soil which contained thorns''.

question: ".....Tend the flock of God...not as domineering over those in your charge but being examples to the flock..." An Elder who exhibits the tenets of Peter's charge in the statement above would be displaying_______
explanation: An Elder who exhibits the tenets of Peter's charge will not behave as if you are more important than someone and have a right to tell that person what to do. They will exhibit humility

question: According to Romans, believers are raised from the dead by the Father so that they walk in________
explanation: Romans 6:4,: "We were buried therefore with him by baptism into death, in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead by the glory of the Father, we too might walk in newness of life."

question: According to Ephesians, Paul enjoins Fathers not to__________
explanation: Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, but bring them up in the discipline Ephesians 6:4

question: According to Mark, after Jesus had triumphantly entered Jerusalem, He__________
explanation: Jesus entered Jerusalem and went into the temple courts. He looked around at everything, but since it was already late, he went out to Bethany with the Twelve. Mark 11:11
options: Went to Bethany with the twelve

question: According to the gospel of John, everyone who does evil hates___________
explanation: Everyone who does evil hates the light, and will not come into the light for fear that their deeds will be exposed. John 3:20-21

question: Nehemiah decided to go back to Jerusalem because of_____________
explanation: In the 20th year of Artaxerxes I (445 or 444 BC), Nehemiah was cup-bearer to the king. Learning that the remnant of Jews in Judah were in distress and that the walls of Jerusalem were broken down, he asked the king for permission to return and rebuild the city. Nehemiah 1:1-7
options: The bad state in which Jerusalem was
His very long stay in Susa
The altar God told him build for him
The cruel treatment given to him by his Master

question: James enjoins believers who lack wisdom to____________
explanation: if any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all generously and without reproach, and it will be given to him. James 1:5

question: Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel and elders before God to renew the Covenant at__________
explanation: Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel to Shechem, and called for the elders . Joshua 24:1-13

question: God commanded Noah not to eat the blood of animals because___________
explanation: One reason God prohibited the consumption of animal blood in the Old Testament was to teach respect for the sacredness of life. Genesis 9
options: It could lead man into covenant with Satan
The blood of animals is meant for idols

question: Moses commissioned Joshua as the new leader of Israel in the presence of_________
explanation: In Numbers 27, upon arrival at Mount Abarim, God tells Moses to go up the mountain see the land and then die. However, God does not tell Moses who his successor will be. Moses reacts in panic and requests a successor be appointed before he dies. God then informs Moses that his successor will be Joshua, and that he should stand him before Elazar the priest and the people and appoint him, which Moses does.

question: Daniel became distinguished above all the other presidents and satraps because_______
explanation: And Daniel was over them, for there was an excellent spirit in him; Daniel 6:3
options: The spirit of wisdom was in him
An excellent spirit was in him

question: The prophet who rebuked King David for his Adultery with Uriah's wife was_______
explanation: The LORD sent Nathan to David.  2 samuel12

question: According to Paul's teaching concerning the second coming of Jesus, the believers will meet the Lord when he is_________
explanation: Christians living at the time of this event will not die, but will be changed and shall be caught up together in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air.

question: If asked to examine Jesus action of cleansing the Temple, what emotions do you think he evoked?
explanation: Awe; a feeling of reverential respect mixed with fear or wonder.

question: According to the beatitudes, the blessing for those who hunger and thirst for righteousness is________
explanation: Blessed are they who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they shall be satisfied.  Matthew 5:3-10

question: ".......But go, show yourself to the priest and offer the gift that moses commanded...." Jesus made the statement above because___________
explanation:
And Jesus said to him, See you tell no man; but go your way, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony to them. Matthew 8:4

In sending the lepers to the priests Jesus is giving them their opportunity to reconnect with loved ones, re-establish careers and resume normal worship and avoid confrontation. It has to do with reintegrating them into society. Priests were able to verify that someone was healthy and had been cured
options: He did not want confrontation from the pharisees
There was need to show appreciation
Such offerings serve as a proof to the people
Without such offerings, the leprosy might come back

question: As Jesus walked by the sea of Galilee, he called_________
explanation: As Jesus was walking beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon called Peter and his brother Andrew. Matthew 4:18

question: Who among these Kings of Judah made peace with the King of Israel during his reign________
explanation: And Jehoshaphat maketh peace with the king of Israel; 1kings 22:44

question: According to Paul to Colossians, the credit for giving belongs to_______
The Main reason King Ahab demanded for Naboth's Vineyard was because he_________
explanation:
1kings 21:-16
Now there was a man named Naboth, from Jezreel, who owned a vineyard in Jezreel beside the palace of King Ahab of Samaria. One day Ahab said to Naboth, “Since your vineyard is so convenient to my palace, I would like to buy it to use as a vegetable garden. I will give you a better vineyard in exchange, or if you prefer, I will pay you for it.”
options: Wanted to add it to his multiple vineyards
Said that the Vineyard was near his House
Intended to use it for a fruit garden
Knew that Naboth was not an Israelite

question: According to Paul in Romans, since all have sinned and fallen short of the glory of God, they are justified by__________
explanation:
Romans 3:23 Because all people have sinned, they have fallen short of God's glory.

24' and are justified freely by His grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus.
